reviews.review: Un juego increible.. vastante intuitivo.. La historia y el jefe final son increibles

Man is this addictive. First of all I wanna say how amazing Valve games are. They have simple yet eligant games. After Talos Principle, this is the most challanging puzzle game I have played. The most replayable and addictive game of all time.

This is a great puzzle game, and has a very interesting story. It's non-combat based, and is a bit short but I highly recommend it if you haven't played it yet.

Geniales Spiel... Vorallem das Ende war sehr unterhaltsam

"Portal" may have been a mere set piece for Valve to show off how clever it is. Even if it's real purpose was to function as a testing ground or proof-of-concept for it's own sequel, it's still a dynamite playthrough. The game's antagonist sums up the experience quite nicely: "Didn't we have some fun, though? Remember when the platform was sliding into the fire pit and I said, "Goodbye," and you were like, "No way!" And then I was all, "We pretended we were going to murder you." That was great."

Also, that song playing during the credits. Best closing tune EVER. The game is built on a simple premise that lends itself to wildy dynamic, ludicrously innovative, mind-bendingly awesome play scenarios. If "Portal" (and it's sequel) is (are?) not the best puzzle game(s) ever made, it (they?) MUST be high on the list. In short, it's one more entry in what the game playing public has come to expect from Valve: top-notch, interactive entertainment that always delivers at the top of it's respective genre.

10/10, two thumbs up. Criminally short, but still a gem. "Cake and grief counseling will be available at the conclusion of the test. Thank you for helping us help you help us all." Would deal with GLaDOS again.

edit: changed rating. In retrospect, it deserved a 10.

Portal is a different game, but in a very good way. Portal incorperates mechanics of many other puzzle games, while adding some new features. The Portal Gun gives gameplay a twist that is amazing and makes the game great. The environment draws a clear path on where the player is supposed to progress, while hiding a fair bit of secrets. But the story of the game is one of the best parts. While there are minimal cutscenes and arguably minimal dialouge, the well written story line is very compelling and interesting. The only downside to Portal is the lack of content included, with a short story and minimal post-game content, which is very much fixed in the sequel, Portal 2. Overall, I would recommend playing Portal, especially as the price drops lower. It will dip your toe in the water for the Portal universe, and if you like it, you can step up to the vastly superior Portal 2. Personally, I got the game for about $2, and it was one of the best $2 I've ever spent.

One of the Best Classic Games I've Played . Cant wait to Finish it and Move on to Portal 2
good game
Excelente, un juego muy entretenido.

This game is utterly fantastic. I bought the valve complete pack and this was the first title i played. I havenâ€™t portal 2 yet, but i will. This game is so immersive, the ominous sounds of the elevators, the dark blank rooms, the unnerving voice. The puzzles never show that its a video game, and are simply acceptable mechanics of this sci-fi world. And the best part of all, the portals, the whole concept of them is still genius to this day. The way they act like regular passageways, yet can take you two the other side of a massive hall in seconds is just mind bending. The mechanics o them are great fun, I especially enjoyed the idea of the velocity staying the same through portals, just genius. I know a good tip on how to deal with these but you should discover yourself I also enjoy how in the later levels it becomes more combat orienated and you learn how to weaponize a portal gun, genius how they did it. Short, but definitely worth playing.
"It's hard to overstate my satisfaction."

La idea no esta mal pero... son repeticiones de mismos eventos vistos desde dinstinta orden los puzzles, cansa rÃ¡pidisimo.

Parece un minimod del half life, basicamente.

Lo recomiendo en oferta tho

It's a short fun game that is challenging, unique, and though it is short, has a pretty good story. There's not a lot not to love save its shortness, but hey, there's Portal 2 so that kinda makes up for it I guess. It's only about around 4-4.5 hours of gameplay if you don't bother with all the achievements. maybe 13-15 hours with. Is it worth the price? Eh, I personally would wait till it's on sale for something like 7$ or less, (I got it for like a little over a dollar on the steam winter sale).
11/10 wouldn't get cake again.
This is my favourite game, but it's short. Quality over quantity I guess.

It's a fun game, and it's one of the essentials for anyone on Steam. It's not the longest game, but it has some fun puzzles and honestly it's worth it. Maybe wait until one of the numerous sales, so you can get a nice bundle with a bunch of Valve games for almost nothing.

This was a very fun and thought provoking game with a refreshing amount of challenge. I finally know where "the cake is a lie" meme comes from. The only problem I have is that the developer commentary audio doesn't take priority over Glados's dialogue. This means that they end up being played at the same time. Other than that I had a great experience even though I was a bit late to the party.

Good evening, I'll tell you about such a wonderful Portal game.
A soulful, meticulously made game for its time. There is not much I can tell you about her, but I just passed it completely, I can share my impressions - firstly, an excellent gameplay,
Secondly - an excellent voice acting,
In the third - excellent graphics;
Of course, the game is notable for times, when the era of computers was just beginning, etc., the game is very impressionable for me and for my brother. It is with great pleasure that I pass the second part of this game, because the plot is very much captivating, in general the developers are developers they tried!
From me 10 out of 10, excellent.
